00033 // If NR_RT_CPUS > 8 RTAI must be changed as it cannot use APIC flat delivery
00034 // and the way processor[?].intr_flag is used must be changed (right now it
00035 // exploits the fact that the IF flags is at bit 9 so that bits 0-7 are used
00036 // to mark a cpu as Linux soft irq enabled/disabled. Bad but comfortable, it 
00037 // will take a very very long time before I'll have available SMP with more
00038 // than 8 cpus. Right now they are only NR_RT_CPUS defined below.
00040 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00041 #define NR_RT_CPUS CONFIG_RTAI_CPUS
00042 #else
00043 #define NR_RT_CPUS  1
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #define RTAI_NR_TRAPS 32
00047

00049

00080 #define IFLAG  9

00100 struct global_rt_status {
00101         volatile unsigned int pending_irqs;
00102         volatile unsigned int activ_irqs;
00103         volatile unsigned int pending_srqs;
00104         volatile unsigned int activ_srqs;
00105         volatile unsigned int cpu_in_sti;
00106         volatile unsigned int used_by_linux;
00107         volatile unsigned int locked_cpus;
00108         volatile unsigned int hard_nesting;
00109         volatile unsigned int hard_lock_all_service;
00110 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_REMOTE_DEBUG
00111         volatile unsigned int used_by_gdbstub;
00112 #endif
00113         spinlock_t hard_lock;
00114         spinlock_t data_lock;
00115 };

00117 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00118 
00119 extern unsigned volatile int *locked_cpus;
00120 
00121 #define STAGGER(x) do { int i = 0; do { nop(); } while (++i < x); } while (0)
00122 
00123 #define rt_spin_lock(lock)    spin_lock((lock))
00124 
00125 #define rt_spin_unlock(lock)  spin_unlock((lock))
00126 
00127 static inline unsigned int hard_cpu_id(void)
00128 {
00129         extern struct rt_hal rthal;
00130         return rthal.apicmap[GET_APIC_ID(apic_read(APIC_ID))];
00131 }
00132 
00133 static inline void rt_get_global_lock(void)
00134 {
00135         hard_cli();
00136         if (!test_and_set_bit(hard_cpu_id(), locked_cpus)) {
00137                 while (test_and_set_bit(31, locked_cpus)) {
00138 #ifdef STAGGER
00139                         STAGGER(hard_cpu_id());
00140 #endif
00141                 }
00142         }
00143 }
00144 
00145 static inline void rt_release_global_lock(void)
00146 {
00147         hard_cli();
00148         if (test_and_clear_bit(hard_cpu_id(), locked_cpus)) {
00149                 test_and_clear_bit(31, locked_cpus);
00150 #ifdef STAGGER
00151                         STAGGER(hard_cpu_id());
00152 #endif
00153         }
00154 }
00155 
00156 static inline void rt_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock)          
00157 {
00158         hard_cli(); 
00159         rt_spin_lock(lock);
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock)
00163 {
00164         rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00165         hard_sti();
00166 }
00167 
00168 // Note that the spinlock calling convention below for irqsave/restore is 
00169 // sligtly different from the one used in Linux. Done on purpose to get an 
00170 // error if you use Linux spinlocks in real time applications as they do not
00171 // guaranty any protection because of the soft irq disable. Be careful and 
00172 // sure to call the other spinlocks the right way, as they are compatible 
00173 // with Linux.
00174 
00175 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock)          
00176 {
00177         unsigned int flags;
00178         hard_save_flags_and_cli(flags);
00179         rt_spin_lock(lock);
00180         return flags;
00181 }
00182 
00183 static inline void rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned int flags,
00184                                                 spinlock_t *lock)
00185 {
00186         rt_spin_unlock(lock);
00187         hard_restore_flags(flags);
00188 }
00189 
00190 /* Global interrupts and flags control (simplified, and modified, version of */
00191 /* similar global stuff in Linux irq.c).                                     */
00192 
00193 static inline void rt_global_cli(void)
00194 {
00195         rt_get_global_lock();
00196 }
00197 
00198 static inline void rt_global_sti(void)
00199 {
00200         rt_release_global_lock();
00201         hard_sti();
00202 }
00203 
00204 static inline unsigned long rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void)
00205 {
00206         unsigned long flags;
00207 
00208         hard_save_flags_and_cli(flags);
00209         if (!test_and_set_bit(hard_cpu_id(), locked_cpus)) {
00210                 while (test_and_set_bit(31, locked_cpus)) {
00211 #ifdef STAGGER
00212                         STAGGER(hard_cpu_id());
00213 #endif
00214                 }
00215                 return ((flags & (1 << IFLAG)) | 1);
00216         } else {
00217                 return (flags & (1 << IFLAG));
00218         }
00219 }
00220 
00221 static inline void rt_global_save_flags(unsigned long *flags)
00222 {
00223         unsigned long hflags, rflags;
00224 
00225         hard_save_flags_and_cli(hflags);
00226         hflags &= (1 << IFLAG);
00227         if (test_bit(hard_cpu_id(), locked_cpus)) {
00228                 rflags = hflags;
00229         } else {
00230                 rflags = hflags | 1;
00231         }
00232         if (hflags) {
00233                 hard_sti();
00234         }
00235         *flags = rflags;
00236 }
00237 
00238 static inline void rt_global_restore_flags(unsigned long flags)
00239 {
00240         switch (flags) {
00241                 case (1 << IFLAG) | 1:  rt_release_global_lock();
00242                                         hard_sti();
00243                                         break;
00244                 case (1 << IFLAG) | 0:  rt_get_global_lock();
00245                                         hard_sti();
00246                                         break;
00247                 case (0 << IFLAG) | 1:  rt_release_global_lock();
00248                                         break;
00249                 case (0 << IFLAG) | 0:  rt_get_global_lock();
00250                                         break;
00251         }
00252 }
00253 
00254 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00255 
00256 #define rt_spin_lock(lock)  
00257 #define rt_spin_unlock(lock)
00258 
00259 #define rt_get_global_lock()      do { hard_cli(); } while (0)
00260 #define rt_release_global_lock()  
00261 
00262 #define rt_spin_lock_irq(lock)    do { hard_cli(); } while (0)
00263 #define rt_spin_unlock_irq(lock)  do { hard_sti(); } while (0) 
00264 
00265 static inline unsigned long rt_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock)
00266 {
00267         unsigned long flags;
00268         hard_save_flags_and_cli(flags);
00269         return flags;
00270 }          
00271 
00272 #define rt_spin_unlock_irqrestore(flags, lock)  do { hard_restore_flags(flags); } while (0)
00273 
00274 #define rt_global_cli()  do { hard_cli(); } while (0)
00275 
00276 #define rt_global_sti()  do { hard_sti(); } while (0) 
00277 
00278 static inline unsigned long rt_global_save_flags_and_cli(void)
00279 {
00280         unsigned long flags;
00281         hard_save_flags_and_cli(flags);
00282         return flags;
00283 }          
00284 
00285 #define rt_global_save_flags(flags)  do { hard_save_flags(*flags); } while (0)
00286 
00287 #define rt_global_restore_flags(flags)  do { hard_restore_flags(flags); } while (0)
00288 
00289 #define hard_cpu_id()  0
00290 
00291 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00292 
00293 static inline unsigned long get_cr2(void)
00294 {
00295         unsigned long address;
00296         __asm__("movl %%cr2,%0":"=r" (address));
00297         return address;
00298 }
00299 
00300 // macros to support hard floating point in interrupt handlers:
00301 // typical sequence to be used:
00302 
00303 // unsigned long cr0;
00304 // unsigned long lfpe[27], tfpe[27];
00305 
00306 // save_cr0_and_clts(cr0);  # To save Linux cr0 state. Always to be done.
00307 // save_fpenv(lfpe);        # To save Linux fpu environment. Needed only if 
00308 //                          # any Linux process uses the fpu.
00309 // restore_fpenv(tfpe);     # To restore your fpu environment. Needed only if
00310 //                          # it can be interrupted or if you left some
00311 //                          # intermediate results in it.
00312 //
00313 // PUT HERE ALL YOUR INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINE FLOATING POINT CALCULATIONS.
00314 //
00315 // save_fpenv(tfpe);     # To save your fpu environment. Needed only if there 
00316 //                       # is a suspect that any intermediate result, to be 
00317 //                       # used at the next interrupts service, can be left
00318 //                       # in it. It should never happen, but maybe the
00319 //                       # compiler can do strange things while optimizing.
00320 // restore_fpenv(lfpe);  # To restore a previously saved Linux fpu environment.
00321 // restore_cr0(cr0);     # To restore Linux cr0. Always to be done.
00322                  
00323 typedef union i387_union FPU_ENV;
00324    
00325 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_FPU_SUPPORT
00326 
00327 #define load_mxcsr(val) \
00328         do { \
00329                 unsigned long __mxcsr = ((unsigned long)(val) & 0xffbf); \
00330                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr)); \
00331         } while (0)
00332 
00333 #define save_cr0_and_clts(x) \
00334         do { \
00335                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("movl %%cr0,%0; clts": "=r" (x)); \
00336         } while (0)
00337 
00338 #define restore_cr0(x) \
00339         do { \
00340                 if (x & 8) { \
00341                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("movl %%cr0, %0": "=r" (x)); \
00342                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("movl %0, %%cr0": :"r" (8 | x)); \
00343                 } \
00344         } while (0)
00345 
00346 #define enable_fpu() \
00347         do { \
00348                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts"); \
00349         } while (0)
00350 
00351 #define init_xfpu() \
00352         do { \
00353                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit"); \
00354                 if (cpu_has_xmm) { \
00355                         load_mxcsr(0x1f80); \
00356                 } \
00357         } while (0)
00358 
00359 #define save_fpenv(x) \
00360         do { \
00361                 if (cpu_has_fxsr) { \
00362                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex": "=m" (x)); \
00363                 } else { \
00364                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait": "=m" (x)); \
00365                 } \
00366         } while (0)
00367 
00368 #define restore_fpenv(x) \
00369         do { \
00370                 if (cpu_has_fxsr) { \
00371                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": : "m" (x)); \
00372                 } else { \
00373                         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": : "m" (x)); \
00374                 } \
00375         } while (0)
00376 
00377 static inline void restore_fpenv_lxrt(struct task_struct *tsk)
00378 {
00379         if (cpu_has_fxsr) {
00380                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fxrstor %0": : "m" (tsk->thread.i387.fxsave));
00381         } else {
00382                 __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; frstor %0": : "m" (tsk->thread.i387.fsave));
00383         }
00384 }
00385 
00386 #else // !CONFIG_RTAI_FPU_SUPPORT
00387 /* For a while, the FPU_ENV was defined to be empty, but that makes the
00388  * ABI (specifically, the size of RT_TASK) dependent on whether you include
00389  * config.h.  Since people probably don't do that correctly, and this is
00390  * the only place where it matters, we won't surprise them.  */
00391 #define save_cr0_and_clts(x)
00392 #define restore_cr0(x)
00393 #define enable_fpu()
00394 #define load_mxcsr(val)
00395 #define init_xfpu()
00396 #define save_fpenv(x)
00397 #define restore_fpenv(x)
00398 #endif // CONFIG_RTAI_FPU_SUPPORT

00509 #define rt_set_timer_delay(x) do  {\
00510         if (x) { \
00511                 outb(x & 0xFF, 0x40);  \
00512                 outb(x >> 8, 0x40);    \
00513         } } while(0)

00554 #undef rdtsc
00555 
00556 #ifdef EMULATE_TSC
00557 #  define rdtsc() rd_8254_ts()
00558 #  define TICK_8254_TSC_EMULATION  do { rdtsc(); } while (0)
00559 #  ifdef CONFIG_VT /* prevent kd_mksound from using the 8254 */
00560 #    define DECLR_8254_TSC_EMULATION \
00561                         extern void *kd_mksound; \
00562                         static void *linux_mksound; \
00563                         static void rtai_mksound(void) { }
00564 #    define SETUP_8254_TSC_EMULATION \
00565                         do { \
00566                             linux_mksound = kd_mksound; \
00567                             kd_mksound = rtai_mksound; \
00568                             rt_setup_8254_tsc(); \
00569                         } while (0)
00570 #    define CLEAR_8254_TSC_EMULATION \
00571                         do { \
00572                             if (linux_mksound) kd_mksound = linux_mksound; \
00573                         } while (0)
00574 #  else /* no CONFIG_VT, no kd_mksound */
00575 #    define DECLR_8254_TSC_EMULATION /* nothing */
00576 #    define SETUP_8254_TSC_EMULATION rt_setup_8254_tsc()
00577 #    define CLEAR_8254_TSC_EMULATION /* nothing */
00578 #  endif /* CONFIG_VT */
00579 #else /* use real TSC */
00580 #  define rdtsc() rd_CPU_ts()
00581 #  define DECLR_8254_TSC_EMULATION
00582 #  define TICK_8254_TSC_EMULATION
00583 #  define SETUP_8254_TSC_EMULATION
00584 #  define CLEAR_8254_TSC_EMULATION
00585 #endif /* EMULATE_TSC */
00586 
00587 #define SAVE_IRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00588         cld; pushl %es; pushl %ds; pushl %eax;\n\t \
00589         pushl %ebp; pushl %ecx; pushl %edx;\n\t \
00590         movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%edx; mov %dx,%ds; mov %dx,%es")
00591 
00592 #define RSTR_IRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00593         popl %edx; popl %ecx; popl %ebp; popl %eax;\n\t \
00594         popl %ds; popl %es; iret")
00595 
00596 #define SAVE_FULL_IRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00597         cld; pushl %es; pushl %ds; pushl %eax;\n\t \
00598         pushl %ebp; pushl %edi; pushl %esi;\n\t \
00599         pushl %edx; pushl %ecx; pushl %ebx;\n\t \
00600         movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%edx; mov %dx,%ds; mov %dx,%es")
00601 
00602 #define RSTR_FULL_IRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00603         popl %ebx; popl %ecx; popl %edx; popl %esi; popl %edi;\n\t \
00604         popl %ebp; popl %eax; popl %ds; popl %es; iret")
00605 
00606 #define SAVE_SRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00607         cld; pushl %es; pushl %ds; pushl %ebp;\n\t \
00608         pushl %edi; pushl %esi; pushl %ecx;\n\t \
00609         pushl %ebx; pushl %edx; pushl %eax;\n\t \
00610         movl $" STR(__KERNEL_DS) ",%ebx; mov %bx,%ds; mov %bx,%es")
00611 
00612 #define RSTR_SRQ_REG __asm__ __volatile__ (" \
00613         popl %eax; popl %edx; popl %ebx; popl %ecx; popl %esi;\n\t \
00614         popl %edi; popl %ebp; popl %ds; popl %es; iret")
00615 
00616 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00617 
00618 // get the time stamp clock (TSC) of a cpu.
00619 static inline unsigned long long rd_CPU_ts(void)
00620 {
00621         unsigned long long time;
00622         __asm__ __volatile__( "rdtsc" : "=A" (time));
00623         return time;
00624 }
00625 
00626 // returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div.
00627 static inline int imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00628 {
00629         int dummy;
00630        __asm__ __volatile__ (\
00631                "mull %%edx; div %%ecx"
00632                : "=a" (i), "=d" (dummy)
00633                : "a" (i), "d" (mult), "c" (div));
00634        return i;
00635 }
00636 
00637 
00638 /*
00639  * ULLDIV as modified by Marco Morandini (morandini@aero.polimi.it) to work 
00640  * with gcc-3.x.x even if the option -fnostrict-aliasing is forgotten, 
00641  * otherwise it does not work properly with -O2. RTAI making should enforce 
00642  * -fnostrict-aliasing always so it should be just in case one uses it on
00643  * his/her own.
00644  */
00645 #define __BIGENDIAN__
00646 #ifdef  __BIGENDIAN__
00647         #define LOW  0
00648         #define HIGH 1 
00649 #else
00650         #define LOW  1
00651         #define HIGH 0  
00652 #endif
00653 
00654 static inline unsigned long long ulldiv(unsigned long long ull, unsigned long uld, unsigned long *r)
00655 {
00656         unsigned long long qf, rf;
00657         unsigned long tq, rh;
00658         union { unsigned long long ull; unsigned long ul[2]; } p, q;
00659 
00660         p.ull = ull;
00661         q.ull = 0;
00662         rf = 0x100000000ULL - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFFUL / uld) * uld;
00663         while (p.ull >= uld) {
00664                 q.ul[HIGH] += (tq = p.ul[HIGH] / uld);
00665                 rh = p.ul[HIGH] - tq * uld;
00666                 q.ull  += rh * qf + (tq = p.ul[LOW] / uld);
00667                 p.ull   = rh * rf + (p.ul[LOW] - tq * uld);
00668         }
00669         *r = p.ull;
00670         return q.ull;
00671 }
00672 
00673 /*
00674  *  u64div32c.c is a helper function provided, 2003-03-03, by:
00675  *  Copyright (C) 2003 Nils Hagge <hagge@rts.uni-hannover.de>
00676  */
00677 
00678 static inline unsigned long long u64div32c(unsigned long long a, unsigned long b, int *r)
00679 {
00680   __asm__ __volatile(
00681     "\n        movl    %%eax,%%ebx"
00682     "\n        movl    %%edx,%%eax"
00683     "\n        xorl    %%edx,%%edx"
00684     "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00685     "\n        xchgl   %%eax,%%ebx"
00686     "\n        divl    %%ecx"
00687     "\n        movl    %%edx,%%ecx"
00688     "\n        movl    %%ebx,%%edx"
00689     : "=a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "=d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1])
00690     : "a" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[0]), "d" (((unsigned long *)((void *)&a))[1]), "c" (b)
00691     : "%ebx"
00692   );
00693   return a;
00694 }
00695 
00696 // returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div.
00697 static inline long long llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div)
00698 {
00699         __asm__ __volatile (\
00700                  "movl %%edx,%%ecx; mull %%esi;       movl %%eax,%%ebx;  \n\t"
00701                  "movl %%ecx,%%eax; movl %%edx,%%ecx; mull %%esi;        \n\t"
00702                  "addl %%ecx,%%eax; adcl $0,%%edx;    divl %%edi;        \n\t"
00703                  "movl %%eax,%%ecx; movl %%ebx,%%eax; divl %%edi;        \n\t"
00704                  "sal $1,%%edx;     cmpl %%edx,%%edi; movl %%ecx,%%edx;  \n\t"
00705                  "jge 1f;           addl $1,%%eax;    adcl $0,%%edx;     1:"
00706                  : "=A" (ll)
00707                  : "A" (ll), "S" (mult), "D" (div)
00708                  : "%ebx", "%ecx");
00709         return ll;
00710 }
00711 
00712 // copied from Linux ffz (simply by taking ~ away).
00713 static __inline__ unsigned long ffnz(unsigned long word)
00714 {
00715         __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00716                 : "=r" (word)
00717                 : "r"  (word));
00718         return word;
00719 }
